Description: At A Glance ‚è±Ô∏é 1 hour êÄ™ 1-20 Guests per booking üóíÔ∏è 7th - 10th March 2024 üç∏ Whisky drams and cocktails available for purchase at the Pop-Up Bar üßæ Pre-order your Amber Meadow bottle with complimentary personalisation by scrolling to the bottom of the ticket page üó®Ô∏è Offered in English __________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Join us for an exclusive unveiling of the third edition of The Macallan Harmony Collection, that spotlights the brand‚Äôs inherent curiosity and innovative and creative mindset. The remarkable collaboration brings together The Macallan and renowned sisters, Stella and Mary McCartney that embarked on a journey united by curiosity, respect, and admiration of the natural world. The third release in The Harmony Collection celebrates the lands of Scotland that connect all those who have stood upon them for generations and inspired by the McCartney sisters' cherished memories of the Scottish countryside and their profound connection to the enchanting landscapes of Scotland. The presentation boxes and bottle labels have been meticulously crafted using discarded meadow cuttings, embracing the art of repurposing natural materials to create beauty from resources at the end of their life cycle, showcasing The Macallan‚Äôs deep connected with the land and to sustainability. Encapsulate the beauty of time through a series of hands-on activities, socially shareable moments, an interactive cocktail garnishing experience and relax in a lounge while savouring The Macallan Harmony Collection Amber Meadow by the dram or in a cocktail. Upon bottle purchase, complimentary personalisation will be available - the perfect gift for a loved one or to treasure for yourself. Immerse yourself in the beauty of Scotland. *All guests must be at least 18 years old. Please savour The Macallan responsibly.
Title: The Macallan Harmony Collection Experience, Inspired By Nature
Subtitle: Join us as we celebrate the latest release in The Macallan Harmony Collection, Inspired by Nature.

Description: A chance to create an underwater artwork with illustrator Jenni Goodman! Learn watercolour techniques and colouring skills. This class runs over three sessions - Monday 11, 18 & 25 March4.30 - 5.30pm Suitable for ages 10 - 16 You will learn: Jenni Goodman‚Äôs artwork is currently on exhibition at SEEN@Swansea. The exhibition Little Horses is based on the new book of the same title. Cost $45 plus booking feeAll materials will be provided. Jenni Goodman first dove into the wonderful world of children‚Äôs book illustration in 2018, when she was honoured with the opportunity to illustrate a series of board books based on the Australian classic, Storm Boy. She now has nine books to her name, and is proud to have had the opportunity to champion animal conservation through the 2020 release of Have You Seen A Tree For Me? and 2024 release of Little Horses. In 2022 she teamed up with her older brother to create the sweet and playful picture book Snuffy which was Shortlisted for the 2022 Speech Pathology Australia Book of the Year. Jenni uses different mediums to create her artworks including watercolour paints and pencils, both coloured and graphite, as well as digital media. She loves capturing the beauty of nature and expressive characters in her illustrations.
Title: Create an underwater artwork with watercolours - after school series
Subtitle: 3 week after school course - Learn watercolour techniques and colouring skills while you create your masterpiece

Description: Amphibians, including frogs, are the most threatened vertebrate class on the planet. Understanding the intricate love lives of frogs may help improve captive breeding success and bolster threatened populations. The southern corroboree frog is one of Australia‚Äôs most iconic and imperilled frog species ‚Äì with less than 50 adult frogs remaining in the wild. However we know very little about the love lives of corroboree frogs... yet! Shannon is an early career researcher who will share her findings from her time studying at the University of Wollongong in collaboration with Taronga. Nature Matters is a new monthly series about the environment and flora and fauna found in the Shoalhaven and surrounds. Don't forget to check out next month's event!
Title: Nature Matters: Corroboree Frogs with Dr. Shannon Kelleher
Subtitle: Learn more about amphibian conservation breeding programs for some of Australia‚Äôs most endangered frogs.

Description: FAQ: Q: How does JobFairX work for job seekers? A: At JobFairX, we match job seekers like you with employers who have registered for the virtual job fair. When you sign up and create a profile, we collect information about your qualifications, skills, and preferences. Our advanced matching algorithm analyzes this data to identify suitable job opportunities. If your qualifications align with a job, you'll receive an email invitation to schedule an interview with the employer during the fair. Our streamlined process saves you time on your job search. Q: How do you match job seekers with employers? A: We match job seekers with employers based on the qualifications and preferences provided in your profile. Q: When can I expect to hear back from the employer after the interview? A: The timeline for hearing back from the employer may vary.
